text: Taylor Swift has 118 million followers on Instagram. Approximately 850,000 of them loved a letter published there supporting lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and gay persons. The letter, which received national news coverage, was addressed to the Republic of Lamar Alexander, a member of the U.S. Senate from Tennessee, Swift's home. She asked him to vote in favour of the Federal Equality Act, which prohibited discrimination on the basis of sex, sexual orientation and gender identity. She then wrote: "A recent study shows that more than 64 per cent of the Tennessee population supports laws to protect LGBT persons from discrimination. It is reported that the majority of Americans in all parties prefer these policies of non-discrimination against LGBT persons (the liberal 81 per cent, the moderate 76 per cent and the conservative 55 per cent).
